abstract: Op-Ed article by investigative reporter Chris Woods suggests United States airstrikes in battle against Islamic State have resulted in significantly more civilian casualties than government has officially acknowledged; argues military is incapable or unwilling to make accurate assessments of civilian casualties, and urges it to make use of credible outside sources for such information.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: As the air war against the Islamic State escalates, America must do a better job of counting the collateral damage.
snippet: As the air war against the Islamic State escalates, America must do a better job of counting the collateral damage....

headline.main: Does the U.S. Ignore Its Civilian Casualties in Iraq and Syria?
headline.print_headline: Our Failure to Count the Dead
